snippet: Kioi Sinfonietta Tokyo celebrated the centennial of Japan’s gift of cherry blossom trees to America on Wednesday evening with a program of Mozart and Beethoven at Alice Tully Hall.
abstract: Vivien Schweitzer reviews performance by the Japanese orchestra Kioi Sinfonietta Tokyo at Alice Tully Hall. (M)
lead_paragraph: Alice Tully Hall It might seem as if a concert honoring the centennial of Japan's gift of cherry blossom trees to America should have included substantial works by Japanese or American composers. Instead the Kioi Sinfonietta Tokyo offered Mozart and Beethoven for its New York debut on Wednesday evening at Alice Tully Hall, part of a four-city tour of the East Coast.
